info.title: Blackbaud Church Management

Returns a list of actions.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: Defines a list identifier used to filter the set of actions to those included in the specified list. If this value is set, other specified filters will be ignored.

parameters.name: computed_status
parameters.description: Represents a filter for results based on the computed action status. Available values are Open, Completed, or PastDue.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: Represents an action status code to filter the results (only applicable when the system is configured to use action status codes). For example, "Pending" returns actions with a status of "Pending".

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 5000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

parameters.name: date_added
parameters.description: Filter the results to actions created on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

parameters.name: last_modified
parameters.description: Filter the results to actions modified on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

get.description: Returns a list of constituents.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: Defines a list identifier used to filter the set of constituents to those included in the specified list. If this value is set, other specified filters will be ignored.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 5000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

parameters.name: constituent_code
parameters.description: Represents a constituent code to filter the list. For example, "Board Member" returns only constituents with a Board Member constituent code.

parameters.name: constituent_id
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of constituent identifiers to filter the results. For example, "280,1232" returns only constituent 280 or constituent 1232.

parameters.name: custom_field_category
parameters.description: Represents a custom field category to filter the results. For example, "Anniversary" returns only constituents with an active Anniversary custom field.

parameters.name: fundraiser_status
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of relationship manager statuses to filter the results. For example, "Active,None" returns only constituents whose relationship manager status is Active or None.  Valid values for this filter are Active, Inactive, and None.

parameters.name: include_deceased
parameters.description: Include deceased constituents in the response?

parameters.name: include_inactive
parameters.description: Include inactive constituents in the response?

parameters.name: postal_code
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of postal codes to filter the results. For example, "29466,29492" returns only constituents whose preferred address has a postal code that starts with 29466 or 29492, such as 29466, 29492, or 29492-0727.

parameters.name: date_added
parameters.description: Filter the results to constituents created on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

parameters.name: last_modified
parameters.description: Filter the results to constituents modified on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Represents a list of fields to sort the results by.  Results are in ascending order by default, and a '-' sign denotes descending order.  For example, "date_added,-last" sorts constituents by the "date_added" field in ascending order and then by the "last" field in descending order.

get.description: Performs a constituent search based on the provided search text. Supports first name, last name, preferred name, former name, alias, email address, phone number, address, or lookup ID. Name combinations such as first name and last name or preferred name and last name are valid, but otherwise search only supports one parameter at a time. By default, searches include results that sound similar to your criteria. For example, searches for "Smith" include matches for "Smyth" and other alternative spellings. This search does not support wildcard characters such as * or ?. Search results are limited to 500 records.

parameters.name: search_text
parameters.description: The search text. Supports first name, last name, preferred name, former name, alias, email address, phone number, address, or lookup ID. Name combinations such as first name and last name or preferred name and last name are valid, but otherwise search only supports one parameter at a time. By default, searches include results that sound similar to your criteria. For example, searches for "Smith" include matches for "Smyth" and other alternative spellings. This search does not support wildcard characters such as * or ?. Search results are limited to 500 records.

parameters.name: fundraiser_status
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of relationship manager statuses to filter the results. For example, "Active,None" returns only constituents whose relationship manager status is Active or None.  Valid values for this filter are Active, Inactive, and None.

parameters.name: include_inactive
parameters.description: Include inactive constituents in the response?

parameters.name: search_field
parameters.description: Represents a field to search on. Currently, it only supports lookup_id. If it is provided with search_text, a constituent with lookup_id that matches the search_text will be returned.

parameters.name: strict_search
parameters.description: Exclude constituents whose names sound like the search text but are spelled differently?

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 5000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

get.description: Returns a list of gifts.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: Defines a list identifier used to filter the set of gifts to those included in the specified list. If this value is set, other specified filters will be ignored.

parameters.name: gift_type
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of gift types to filter the results. For example, "MatchingGiftPledge,RecurringGift" returns only gifts of type MatchingGiftPledge or RecurringGift.

parameters.name: constituent_id
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of constituent identifiers to filter the results. For example, "280,1232" returns only gifts from constituent 280 or constituent 1232.

parameters.name: campaign_id
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of campaign identifiers to filter the results. For example, "506,918" returns only gifts to campaign 506 or campaign 918.

parameters.name: fund_id
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of fund identifiers to filter the results. For example, "506,918" returns only gifts to fund 506 or fund 918.

parameters.name: appeal_id
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of appeal identifiers to filter the results. For example, "506,918" returns only gifts to appeal 506 or appeal 918.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 5000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

parameters.name: start_gift_date
parameters.description: Represents a filter for gifts with a gift date on or after the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

parameters.name: end_gift_date
parameters.description: Represents a filter for gifts with a gift date on or before the specified date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

parameters.name: start_gift_amount
parameters.description: Represents a filter for gifts with an amount greater than or equal to the specified amount.

parameters.name: end_gift_amount
parameters.description: Represents a filter for gifts with an amount less than or equal to the specified amount.

parameters.name: post_status
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of gift post statuses to filter the results. For example, "DoNotPost,Posted" returns only gifts that are marked as DoNotPost or Posted.

parameters.name: receipt_status
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of gift receipt statuses to filter the results. For example, "DoNotReceipt,Receipted" returns only gifts that are marked as DoNotReceipt or Receipted.

parameters.name: acknowledgement_status
parameters.description: Represents a comma-separated list of gift acknowledgement statuses to filter the results. For example, "DoNotAcknowledge,Acknowledged" returns only gifts that are marked as DoNotAcknowledge or Acknowledged.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Represents a list of fields to sort the results by.  Results are in ascending order by default, and a '-' sign denotes descending order.  For example, "date_added,-date" sorts gifts by the "date_added" field in ascending order and then by the "gift date" field in descending order. If only the date_modified field or only the date_added field is provided, then this adds the sort_token parameter to the next_link URL to ensure that gifts are stably sorted.

200.description: Returned when the operation successfully creates a custom field. The response body contains the ID of the new custom field.

400.description: Returned when the request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to create the custom field.

404.description: Returned when the specified gift is not found.

parameters.name: custom_field_id
parameters.description: The system record ID of the custom field to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the properties of the custom field to update.

200.description: Returned when the operation successfully updates the custom field.

400.description: Returned when the specified custom field ID in the request URL or the specified request parameters are not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to update the custom field.

404.description: Returned when the specified custom field is not found.

get.description: Lists the gift custom field categories.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to view custom field categories.

post.description: Add a gift to the specified gift batch.

parameters.name: batch_id
parameters.description: The batch to which the gift will be added.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the gift to add to the batch.

200.description: Returned when the operation successfully adds the gifts to the batch. The response body contains a list of IDs and any exceptions that occured when adding the gifts.

400.description: Returned when the specified request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to add gifts to the batch.

get.description: List the gift batches.

parameters.name: batch_number
parameters.description: Represents a filter for results that match the specified number.

parameters.name: approved
parameters.description: Represents a filter for the status of the gift batch.

parameters.name: has_exceptions
parameters.description: Represents a filter for whether the gift batch contains exceptions.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to return. The default is 500. The maximum is 5000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Represents the number of records to skip. For use with pagination.

parameters.name: search_text
parameters.description: Represents a filter for text included in the batch description or batch number fields.

parameters.name: created_by
parameters.description: Represents a filter for gift batches created by the specified user.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have rights to view the set of gift batches.

post.description: Creates a new gift batch.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the gift batch to create.

200.description: Returned when the operation successfully creates a gift batch. The response body contains the ID of the new batch.

400.description: Returned when the specified request body is not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to create the gift batch.

post.description: Add a set of records to an existing list.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the set of records to append to the list.

400.description: Returned when the specified request parameters are not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to modify lists.

post.summary: Create a list from a set of records
post.description: Creates a new list filtered to the specified set of records.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An object that represents the list to create.

200.description: Returned when the operation successfully creates a list. The response body contains the ID of the new list.

400.description: Returned when the specified request parameters are not in the appropriate format.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to create lists.

get.description: Get a list of lists.

parameters.name: list_type
parameters.description: The type of list to return.

ConstituentApi.ActionAdd.description: Actions track the interactions and tasks that are required to secure gifts and cultivate relationships with constituents.

constituent_id.description: The system record ID of the constituent associated with the action.

date.description: The action date (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

category.description: The channel or intent of the constituent interaction.

type.description: Additional description of the action to complement the category.

summary.description: The short description of the action that appears at the top of the record. Character limit: 255.

description.description: The detailed explanation that elaborates on the action summary.

completed.description: Is the action completed? If the system is configured to use custom action statuses, this value is based on the action status value.

completed_date.description: The date when the action was completed (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z').

start_time.description: The start time of the action. Uses 24-hour time in the HH:mm format.

end_time.description: The end time of the action. Uses 24-hour time in the HH:mm format.

fundraisers.description: The set of system record IDs for the relationship managers associated with the action.

ConstituentApi.ActionAttachmentAdd.description: Many cultivation activities collect related collateral, such as correspondence and prospect research. Attachments can save this data on the appropriate record to maintain a complete view of those activities.

parent_id.description: The system record ID of the action associated with the attachment.

type.description: The attachment type. Physical attachments are uploaded files such as images, PDFs, or Word documents that are saved locally or on the network. They are stored and managed in the system. Link attachments are links to files such as images, blog posts, or YouTube videos that are online or in a cloud storage account. They are stored and managed externally.

name.description: The name of the attachment. Character limit: 150.

date.description: The date of the attachment (ex: '2020-09-18T04:13:56Z'). This field defaults to the current date and time if not supplied.

url.description: The URL for the attachment. This is required for link attachments and not applicable for physical attachments.

file_name.description: The name of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

file_id.description: The identifier of the file. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

thumbnail_id.description: The identifier of the thumbnail. Character limit: 36. For physical attachments only.

ConstituentApi.AddressAdd.description: Addresses store information about constituent residences and other addresses along with information about where or whether to send mail.

They are stored and managed in the system. Link attachments are links to files such as images, blog posts, or YouTube videos that are online or in a cloud storage account. They are stored and managed externally.

type.description: The attachment type. Physical attachments are uploaded files such as images, PDFs, or Word documents that are saved locally or on the network. They are stored and managed in the system. Link attachments are links to files such as images, blog posts, or YouTube videos that are online or in a cloud storage account. They are stored and managed externally.
